title: 12 suitcases, 20 timers & a rifle: Twist in Delhi arms bust case; woman doctor under lens
content: A significant counter-terror operation in Faridabad has unearthed a large cache of explosives and weapons, including 360 kg of suspected ammonium nitrate and an assault rifle. This discovery follows the arrest of a doctor linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed, suggesting a major terror module has been dismantled. Investigations are ongoing to apprehend further operatives.

title: Straight out of ‚ÄòDolly Ki Doli‚Äô: ‚ÄòLooteri dulhan‚Äô married over 10 men; here‚Äôs how cops tracked her
content: Police have arrested Rani Kumari, a woman accused of marrying dozens of men for mere hours before disappearing with their valuables. Her husband and mother, also part of the gang, were apprehended alongside her. Authorities recovered cash and jewelry. Another gang member was later caught with a significant sum and a vehicle. This gang targeted families through fraudulent marriages.

title: 'Grateful to be living in Goa': Jonty Rhodes says Delhi air 'hard to digest'
content: South African cricket legend Jonty Rhodes voiced concern over Delhi's severe air quality, contrasting it with his clean Goan home. The capital endured a thick smog, with AQI readings in the 'very poor' category, nearing 'severe'. Delhi's environment minister highlighted government efforts while criticizing the previous administration's decade of inaction on pollution.

title: Thailand-Cambodia conflict: PM Anutin suspends peace deal over landmine explosion; two soldiers injured
content: Thailand has suspended its Malaysia-brokered peace deal with Cambodia following a landmine explosion that injured two Thai soldiers near their shared border. Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul cited the incident as proof of ongoing hostility, halting disarmament and border demilitarisation efforts. The suspension includes the release of detained Cambodian soldiers, as Thailand plans to file a formal complaint with regional observers.

title: $3bn Google hire faces backlash: Elon Musk offers support, says he is right
content: Elon Musk publicly supported Google employee Noam Shahzeer's views on gender identity, stating "Noam is right." Shahzeer's internal remarks questioned the concept of gender and medical interventions for minors, leading to internal backlash and censorship at Google. This comes as Google reacquired Shahzeer's AI company, Character.AI, for $2.7 billion, highlighting intense competition for AI talent.

title: IPL: 'Dhoni might leave mid-season if Samson joins CSK' - Ex-India cricketer drops bombshell
content: Speculation is rife about a blockbuster IPL trade involving Ravindra Jadeja, Sam Curran, and Sanju Samson between CSK and RR. Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif suggests MS Dhoni is driving the potential move, seeing it as a strategic step to secure a long-term leader in Samson, possibly marking Dhoni's final IPL chapter.

title: Russian chopper crash in Dagestan: Video shows moment helicopter splits into two
content: A Russian Ka-226 helicopter crashed in Dagestan, killing at least five people, including four employees of defense manufacturer KEMZ. The helicopter reportedly clipped a pier during landing, then attempted to take off again before crashing near a village. The cause of the disaster is under investigation.

title: IPL 2026 - Who after Samson? Jurel, Jaiswal front runners for RR's captaincy
content: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel and opener Yashasvi Jaiswal are front runners for the captaincy once Sanju Samson IPL trade is finalised. The franchise is already in a huddle with regards to captaincy and Kumar Sangakkara, in consultation with the owners, is likely to take that call with eye on the future.

title: H-1B alert: US immigration body starts issuing $100K fee demands; experts decode surge in RFEs
content: USCIS is issuing Requests for Evidence demanding a new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, causing confusion among immigration attorneys and employers. This follows a September presidential order, but RFEs are appearing even where the fee may not apply, sparking legal challenges and prompting companies to reassess hiring strategies. Indian applicants, forming 70% of H-1B recipients, face significant impact.

title: Trump admin tightens noose! Asks evidence of $100,000 H-1B fee; what it means for Indians
content: USCIS is issuing requests for a $100,000 H-1B visa fee, even for cases seemingly exempt, causing confusion and potential legal battles, particularly for Indian applicants. This follows an executive order, but ambiguity in its wording and application is leading to challenges and prompting companies to rethink overseas hiring strategies.

title: 2020 riots case: Delhi court sets aside order to investigate Kapil Mishra's role
content: A Delhi court has overturned a previous order that mandated the police to investigate former minister Kapil Mishra's alleged role in the 2020 riots. Both Mishra and the Delhi Police had contested the magistrate's directive for further inquiry. The Sessions Court has now instructed the magistrate to continue proceedings as per legal procedures.

title: Sam Altman says, ‚ÄòSlack creates a lot of fake work‚Äô; Elon Musk responds
content: Elon Musk believes OpenAI, led by Sam Altman, will directly challenge Microsoft after Altman criticized current office tools like Slack for creating "fake work." Altman envisions AI agents handling communication, while Musk's comment suggests OpenAI's new ventures, including selling AI cloud compute, will put it in competition with tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google.

title: Trump's $2,000 dividend for Americans, are you eligible? Check structure, date & more
content: Donald Trump announced a $2,000 per person dividend funded by tariff revenues, excluding high-income individuals. While details on eligibility, structure, and timing remain unclear, the proposal could be implemented through tax changes like deductions and tax-free tips. This initiative, requiring congressional approval, faces scrutiny regarding the legality of tariffs.

title: T20 World Cup: 'Never celebrate a loss' - Gautam Gambhir reveals Team India's mindset
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir is instilling accountability and honesty in the Indian team, emphasising a results-driven approach for the T20 World Cup 2026. He believes in testing players under pressure and fostering a transparent dressing room. Gambhir stated the team is still developing but aims to peak at the right time, highlighting the importance of fitness and commitment.

title: Video of namaz at Bengaluru airport goes viral; BJP targets Karnataka govt
content: A video of Muslims praying at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport Terminal 2 has ignited a political storm. The BJP is demanding answers from the state government, questioning permission for prayers in a high-security zone and contrasting it with restrictions on RSS activities. The government has yet to comment on the security implications.

title: ‚ÄòSend him back to Uganda‚Äô: Republicans seek to revoke Mamdani‚Äôs citizenship ‚Äî Is it possible?
content: Zohran Mamdani, New York City's mayor-elect, faces opposition from Republicans who question his citizenship and accuse him of communist ties. Despite claims of involvement with "terrorist" ideologies, immigration experts state denaturalization requires clear evidence of illegal procurement or material lies, which is currently lacking. Mamdani became a US citizen in 2018.

title: Caution! 'Don‚Äôt fall for fake promises': Sunil Gavaskar warns India women's team
content: India's women's cricket team achieved a historic first by winning the World Cup on November 2, 2025, defeating South Africa. This triumph, a culmination of years of effort and the rise of the WPL, sparked nationwide celebrations and inspired a new generation.

title: 'Go and attack!' - Akash Choudhary reveals mindset behind eight sixes in a row
content: Meghalaya's Akash Kumar Choudhary shattered Ranji Trophy records with the fastest first-class fifty in just 11 balls, including eight consecutive sixes. Batting at number eight, his aggressive knock of 50 off 14 balls helped Meghalaya declare at 628/6. Chaudhary credited his coach for the fearless approach and expressed pride in India's Women's World Cup win.

title: Gold rate rises Rs 1,200 to hit Rs 1,22,290 per 10 grams - What should investors do?
content: Gold and silver prices surged on Monday, driven by heightened safe-haven demand following disappointing US consumer sentiment and employment data. Global spot gold and US gold futures also saw increases. Analysts anticipate continued volatility due to economic uncertainties and potential Federal Reserve rate cuts.

title: Singing Vande Mataram compulsory in all educational institutions of UP: CM Yogi
content: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday mandated the singing of 'Vande Mataram' in all state educational institutions to foster national pride. This move follows Prime Minister Modi's criticism of the Congress party for allegedly removing stanzas from the national song, which he linked to the seeds of partition.

title: Indians abducted in Mali: Embassy vows safe release; calls it an 'unfortunate incident'
content: Five Indian nationals were kidnapped in Mali. The Indian Embassy is actively collaborating with Malian authorities to ensure their swift and safe return. The men were working on an electrification project when gunmen intercepted their convoy. Remaining employees have been safely evacuated. Mali faces ongoing threats from jihadist groups, leading to travel advisories from several nations.

title: Yes King dies: What led to the death of TikTok star Michael Willis?
content: TikTok sensation Michael Willis Heard, known as 'Yes King,' has passed away. His daughter confirmed the news, remembering him for his uplifting videos promoting self-love and confidence. The Elyria, Ohio native, who also served as a life coach and pastor-like figure, inspired millions with his positive energy. His sudden departure has deeply saddened his global fanbase.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the rate outlook for this week? Things to watch out
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are set to react to global economic shifts this week. The US dollar's strength and reduced expectations for Fed rate cuts are currently impacting gold. Upcoming US government funding news and trade talks between the US and China will be key drivers.

title: Party behind bars: After phone and TV clips, new Bengaluru Jail video shows prisoners drinking, dancing
content: Bengaluru Central Prison faces renewed controversy as a video emerges showing inmates partying with liquor and makeshift instruments. This follows earlier footage of high-profile prisoners using phones and watching TV. Home Minister G Parameshwara vows stringent action against officials and promises improved surveillance, including CCTVs and jammers, to curb these repeated security breaches.

title: 'From suspension to swap?' - Why Jadeja made a shock exit from Rajasthan Royals in 2010
content: IPL 2025 trade talks are heating up as Chennai Super Kings and Rajasthan Royals discuss a potential Ravindra Jadeja-Sanju Samson swap. This comes after RR's previous attempt to acquire Jadeja, who was controversially released by them in 2010 for contract violations, potentially leading to a full-circle return.

title: Hyderabad realtor kills wife with cricket bat over suspicion of infidelity
content: A real estate businessman allegedly bludgeoned his wife to death with a cricket bat in Ameenpur, suspecting her of infidelity. The victim, an assistant bank manager, died at the scene after a heated argument. Their son alerted grandparents and neighbours, leading to the husband's arrest and the weapon's seizure by police.

title: Nepal trek tragedy: Missing Surat father-daughter duo found buried under snow
content: The bodies of Surat-based teacher Jignesh Patel and his daughter Priyanshi were discovered buried in snow in Nepal's Manang district. The duo, who went missing during a trekking expedition near the Annapurna-3 peak, were last heard from on October 21. Authorities launched extensive aerial and ground searches after their family raised an alarm.

title: Watch: Indian man in US goes viral for helping paralysed woman stranded in heavy rain
content: An Indian man in the United States stopped to help a paralyzed woman stranded in heavy rain. He offered her a ride to her daughter's house. The man shared the video on Instagram, recounting the moving encounter. The clip captured widespread attention and touched viewers with its display of humanity.

title: From 'fun start' to 'fun end': Pakistan captain's brutal reply to India skipper
content: In the final, Pakistan were at their ruthless best. Batting first, they piled up 135/3 with explosive hitting across the order. Kuwait, who had stunned several big teams including Afghanistan, India, and England to reach the final, began their chase in blazing fashion ‚Äî hammering 32 runs off the opening over. But Pakistan‚Äôs bowlers regrouped swiftly. Shahzad, Maaz Sadaqat, and Abbas Afridi bowled tight lines, triggering a dramatic collapse. Kuwait went from dream start to total despair, eventually folding well short of the target.

title: 23-yr-old Andhra Pradesh student found dead in US
content: A 23-year-old Andhra Pradesh student, Rajyalakshmi Yarlagadda, tragically passed away in her sleep in the US on November 7. A recent graduate, she harbored dreams of supporting her farming family back home. Her sudden demise has left her loved ones heartbroken and facing financial strain, prompting a GoFundMe to cover funeral costs and aid her parents.

title: Lenskart listing today: After stellar IPO, shares list at 3% discount; check details
content: Lenskart Solutions made its stock market debut today on NSE and BSE, following a highly subscribed IPO. Despite strong investor interest, pre-listing sentiment saw the grey market premium shrink. Analysts offer mixed views, with some citing valuation concerns while others praise its resilient business model and growth potential in the expanding eyewear market.

title: Sexual harassment in women's cricket: 'Zero tolerance' - BCB chief vows strict action
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board launches a probe into sexual harassment allegations by cricketer Jahanara Alam against a former selector Manjurul Alam.  The BCB president Aminul Islam vows zero tolerance, assuring no one is above the law. A three-member committee will investigate, with four officials placed on special duty pending the inquiry's findings.

title: Ecuador prison clash: Violence over transfer to 'maximum-security' prison; 31 killed
content: At least 31 inmates perished in a brutal clash at Ecuador's Machala Prison, with authorities citing asphyxiation as the cause for many. The violence, marked by gunfire and screams, is the latest in a series of deadly prison riots fueled by overcrowding and gang rivalries. This incident highlights the escalating crisis within Ecuador's penal system.

title: Can India find a place for Dhruv Jurel in South Africa series?
content: Dhruv Jurel scored his maiden Test century against West Indies last month in the absence of an injured Pant before hitting back-to-back unbeaten and commanding tons in the second unofficial Test against South Africa ‚ÄòA‚Äô in Bengaluru in the past seven days. Sudharsan‚Äôs indifferent returns at No. 3 since his debut at Leeds in June will test the team management‚Äôs resolve.

title: Ecuador, not Everest, is the closest place on Earth to outer space; here‚Äôs the reason
content: Ecuador's Mount Chimborazo is scientifically closer to space than Mount Everest, not due to sea-level height, but Earth's equatorial bulge. This bulge makes points near the equator farther from the planet's center. Chimborazo's summit extends 2.1 kilometers further from Earth's core than Everest's, making it the most distant surface point from the planet's center and thus closest to outer space.

title: Mystery deepens around Aaron Rodgers‚Äô wife Brittani after shocking update before Steelers‚Äô Sunday Night Football
content: Aaron Rodgers' marriage to Brittani has become a major talking point, with no one, not even his teammates or family, having met her. Rodgers stated his wife is private and chooses not to be in the public eye, leaving her identity and presence a mystery despite his openness about being married.

title: US shutdown crisis averted? Senators strike bipartisan deal ‚Äì all you need to know
content: US senators reached an agreement to end the 40-day government shutdown, with a future vote on extending Affordable Care Act subsidies as part of the deal. President Trump indicated the shutdown would end soon, while Senate Republicans confirmed a spending package was coming together. The agreement includes full-year funding for some departments and extends funding for others through January.

title: Tom Brady reacts after Fox Sports replaces Mark Sanchez with Drew Brees
content: Tom Brady reacts to Drew Brees replacing Mark Sanchez at FOX Sports as the network cuts ties with Sanchez amid his felony case. Brady‚Äôs accuracy comment, Brees‚Äô career stats and statements, and FOX‚Äôs broadcast shakeup headline a major shift. Full details on Brees‚Äô new role, Sanchez‚Äôs exit and what Brady‚Äôs reaction means for FOX Sports.

title: Klay Thompson apologizes to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: ‚ÄòHelp us breathe‚Äô: Delhi AQI slips to ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô; protesters rally at India Gate, many detained
content: Dozens were detained at India Gate during a clean air protest, with participants demanding urgent government action against Delhi's "air emergency." Protesters, including parents and children, highlighted the health crisis with poignant placards and symbolic props. Police stated only those blocking traffic were detained and later released.

title: Legendary NBA player, coach Wilkens dies at 88
content: Lenny Wilkens, a smooth playmaker who was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame as both a player and a coach, has died. He was 88.

title: Guardians' Clase, Ortiz indicted for pitch rigging
content: Cleveland Guardians pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz have been indicted on a host of charges related to an alleged scheme to rig bets on pitches thrown in MLB games. Ortiz is in custody.

title: Allen draws up play to set Chargers' catch mark
content: Chargers wide receiver Keenan Allen became the franchise's all-time leader in receptions with 956 catches, passing Hall of Fame tight end Antonio Gates.

title: Campbell takes over playcalling; Lions score 44
content: Lions coach Dan Campbell took over playcalling duties from first-year offensive coordinator John Morton this past week, and it ignited a dominant 44-22 victory over the Washington Commanders on Sunday.

title: Rodgers offers blunt self-assessment after SNF dud
content: "This was not my best performance," QB Aaron Rodgers said after the worst game of his Steelers career, which came in a 25-10 loss to the Chargers on "Sunday Night Football."

title: Lawrence wows with near-identical defensive TDs
content: DeMarcus Lawrence became the fourth player in NFL history with multiple fumble return touchdowns in the same game, doing so on near-identical plays Sunday against the Cardinals.

title: Rams WRs: Stafford belongs in MVP conversation
content: Rams receiver Davante Adams said he thinks quarterback Matthew Stafford's play has "looked like MVP play to me all year, to be honest."

title: Giants' Dart suffers concussion in loss to Bears
content: Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart was ruled out in the fourth quarter against the Bears with a concussion.

title: Week 10 winners and losers: Taylor, Henderson shine while Jefferson, Darnold struggle
content: Jonathan Taylor and TreVeyon Henderson led the way with big Week 10 performances, while Justin Jefferson and San Darnold were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Henderson steps up for Patriots; injuries take toll
content: TreVeyon Henderson had himself a game with Rhamondre Stevenson out, but injuries put a damper on the day.

title: Man City show their potential by capping big week with signature win over Liverpool
content: In seven days, Man City have beaten Bournemouth, Dortmund, and now Liverpool. Pep Guardiola & Co. are officially back to their best.

content: Liverpool scored an equalizer against Man City. But why was it given offside for a player in front of the goalkeeper?

content: Has Indiana's Fernando Mendoza separated himself from the QB pack? We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 11.

content: Curt Cignetti and Joey McGuire were among the coaches to sound off with memorable quotes after Week 11.

content: Dowdle, who was fined for recreating the iconic "Key & Peele" character's celebration, stopped short of another fine -- and Jones followed suit.

content: What's the best strategy and pick for the Heisman Trophy after a dramatic weekend in college football?

content: Free agency starts at 5 p.m. ET Thursday. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: ‚öæ Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts
content: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.

title: üìà Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Bama top CFP ranking
content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: ‚öæ Former MLB star Strawberry pardoned by Trump
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former MLB great Darryl Strawberry, the 1983 NL Rookie of the Year and an eight-time All-Star, of tax evasion and drug charges dating back to the latter part of his playing career.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Szoboszlai wanted by Man City, Real Madrid
content: Dominik Szoboszlai's Liverpool contract situation is being monitored by Manchester City and Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: Joint team of Faridabad and Jammu and Kashmir police arrested the doctor who was also wanted in connection with putting up posters supporting terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed in Srinagar, says police

title: Kochi water tank collapse: Tremors, shocks and soaked dreams as Thammanam residents reel from sudden flooding
content: A water storage tank in Thammanam collapsed early Monday morning, flooding nearby houses and causing significant property damage. The incident also damaged vehicles and a local healthcare centre

content: According to airport sources, the private jet with six passengers on board was taxing towards the runway for take-off when the pilot of another aircraft noticed smoke emanating from its engine

content: More than 220 student delegates from various colleges and universities across North Karnataka are participating in the two-day programme

content: Climate change is rapidly melting glaciers in the Indian Himalayan Region, threatening water security for 77 million people. Immediate adaptation strategies are crucial to address this growing crisis

content: A Bench of Justices J.K. Maheshwari, Vijay Bishnoi issued notice to National Highways Authority of India, the Ministry, seeking their replies in two weeks on the cause of the accident

content: Police personnel residing in the quarters chased the five-member gang and managed to arrest one of the suspects, identified as Ilamaran.

content: Students have been holding a protest against the Centre's now-withdrawn decision to restructure the university's governing bodies ‚Äî Senate and Syndicate

content: Rahul Gandhi calls for decisive action on air pollution "right now, instead of attacking citizens asking for clean air"

content: ‚ÄúIt may work in other States, but as far as Tamil Nadu is concerned, with the DMK here, it will never work,‚Äù Mr. Stalin said.

content: The incident took place around 9:45 pm on November 9, when they were sleeping in their residence at Manas village under the Akilpur Police Station limits, says police

content: The four candidates elected unopposed are Somasekhar Gonaik, Gurunath Reddy Parvath Reddy, Sidram Reddy Mallikarjun Reddy, and Basavaraj Sanganagouda Patil

title: The torch of American progressive history is being passed to a new generation: Corey Robin on Mamdani‚Äôs victory
content: Zohran Mamdani‚Äôs win as New York City‚Äôs Mayor is a triumph of a kind of democratic action that the country has not seen in a long time, says political theorist Corey Robin; he has made it very clear that the fight against authoritarianism and the fight for affordability are two sides of the same coin, Robin adds

title: BJP confident of winning Jubilee Hills seat, accuses Congress of communal politics

title: Disruption grows in Uttar Pradesh industrial clusters due to U.S. tariffs as demand for bailout grows louder

title: Trinamool Congress continues to blame SIR for unnatural deaths in West Bengal
content: The SIR exercise began on November 4. Between October 28 and November 7, at least 11 deaths‚Äîincluding six by suicide and two suicide attempt‚Äîhave been highlighted by the Trinamool Congress alleging fear of disenfranchisement through the SIR process.

content: The deceased were identified as S. Nirmala (40), a wage worker near Vaniyambadi town, and S. Ramesh (40), who works as lab technician at Government Stanley Hospital in Chennai.

content: The topographical survey has begun simultaneously in different Corporation wards, and it will soon be followed by a consumer survey

title: KSRTC‚Äôs initiative for visually challenged passengers wins national award

title: Explosives, Guns Recovered From J&K Doctors In Faridabad: 10 Big Revelations
content: Two Kashmiri doctors' arrests have led to the recovery of about 350 kg of explosives suspected to be ammonium nitrate and arms and ammunition from a house in Haryana's Faridabad. The accused were identified as Adeel Ahmad Rather and Muzammil Ganaie.

title: Week 11 intel: Auburn fallout, Texas' moves and biggest visits
content: the recruiting trail has heated up this week as the clock ticks down on the 2026 class . Ohio State, Texas and Texas Tech are among the programs charging for late-cycle flips . the market for premium defensive tackles, led by fall decommits Danny Beale, Dylan Berymon and Emanuel Ruffin, is intensifying this month .

title: Tiering all 32 NFL teams by their playoff chances: Where does each team land?
content: team strength, injuries, tiebreakers, future strength of schedule and more can shift odds up or down . ESPN analytics writer seth Walder broke down all 32 teams into nine tiers of playoff hopes . the tier is based on information from ESPN's Football Power Index (FPI), betting lines , performance metrics, health status and some instinct .

title: Predicting matchups for the CFP and every bowl game after Week 11's thrillers
content: the Big Ten provided the biggest thrills in Week 11, with Indiana and Oregon both narrowly fending off upsets in dramatic fashion . but Texas Tech delivered the biggest win of the weekend, handing BYU its first loss of the season and securing its standing as the team to beat in the Big 12 . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8.
